column4: I'm running breezy. How do i switch my source temporarily to dapper drake?
dapper i mean
Im only grabbing a single item
that is a recipe for certain destruction
you might as well switch repos and do apt-get dist-upgrade
yup
.... there's always a chance.. dapper changes rapidly, i get update requests at least once a day
but I run dapper on both my home machine, and my work laptop, and it seems to run fine.
ah.
how much of a download is the upgrade?
don't know.. I'm gonna guess about 400 megs worth of stuff. I installed dapper from CD
and i've had roughly about 400 megs worth of upgrades in the time since I upgraded.
All i'm looking to do is install the version of ruby that comes with dapper. How can I change my sources temporarily to do that?
trying to install Rails? :-D
Rails 1.1 breaks on ruby 1.8.3
*nod* I need to figure out how to get a rails environment properly running on my laptop when i get a chance
but I've had to put my rails work on the back burner because my work load is insane.
(I am developing an ecommerce engine in rails)
interesting. substruct is the only one ive seen so far.
substruct isn't really all that interesting....
nope, it's pretty limited. It's the only one ive seen though.
it's really an embeddable engine meant for existing rails projects.
I'm writing one which uses AJAX extensively for in-place editing of most common functions on the page itself.
with a floating administration menu (using what I call a floater icon, which stays in window at all times)
